intro: Ipomoea uruguayensis var. glabrata, commonly known as the Uruguay morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy blue to violet flowers that open in the morning and close in the late afternoon. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces tendrils that help it climb and support its growth. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The variety glabrata is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves compared to other varieties of Ipomoea uruguayensis.
